channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: This road is beyond a joke do the council actually look at those reports as there’s multiple reports along this road and it’s been like this for months, 28th January
item.description:
The old Gloucester Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian cross button illuminates when pressed then goes out after 10 or so seconds. Even pressing repeatedly, it can three full cycles before pedestrians get green man to cross., 28th January
item.description:
Lights at junction of London Road, Old Bath Road and Hales Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hales Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe flooding after rain, 28th January
item.description:
This never used to flood. Flooding is so bad now that it is now impassable for pedestrians following heavy rain as you cannot see the pavement. The flood water covers both sides of the road so you cannot see where the road ends and the pavement kerb begins - so you don't know where to drive until the water subsides and you can follow the cats eyes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 28th January
item.description:
2 potholes outside our car port 0.5 metre long 3.5". Tarmac and hardcore is being flicked up onto our vehicles.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 28th January
item.description:
Customer is wanting to claim for damage to thier car.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 28th January
item.description:
Customer reports that the surface of the road has degraded to the point that he can't ride his motorcycle down it.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3" deep in places. 50"+ in length. Multiple potholes, 28th January
item.description:
On Church road ~10m prior to river - on left as you approach from Brizen Park. "Fixed" twice since December, and outrageously classed as "not meet(ing) our criteria for an urgent repair" less than one week ago. There are at least three URGENT repairs needed here. Cars are clattering into wrecking suspension, or swerving into other lane. Please fix these potholes properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous on pavement parking in school zone, 28th January
item.description:
Cars parked over restriction lines near a junction, opposite school zigzags and next to a school crossing area. Cars there all day and night, sometimes a work van. This causes lack of visibility to school children, car drivers and bus drivers. Opposite is a work entrance for the school at the moment, large vehicles coming and going, school buses turning. What are the restriction lines on the road for? Can they be enforced?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pathway., 28th January
item.description:
Outside no 28 Wards Road to 32. The path is hazardous as uneven. It is used regularly by a range of people & is a trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Wards Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuously flooded road, 28th January
item.description:
This section of road floods all the time and is a hazard due to the number of drivers that drive down the middle of the road, thus being in oncoming traffics lane. There is clearly a flood issue. If nothing else it should be pumped when it gets particularly bad.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same
